title: Virtual Reality-Based Surgical Simulation Training: Enhancing Expertise Through Repetitive Practice

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic medical terminology and surgical procedures, experience with VR devices
context.additional_context: Learners are office/administrative workers, requiring online learning environments outside work hours. Digital devices (tablet/PC) provided and VR headset rental system established

learning_goals: Learners sequentially complete three difficulty-level VR simulation trainings (basic-intermediate-advanced) and achieve a performance success rate of over 90%.
Learners can explain three or more cognitive load management strategies (breath control, procedural segmentation) by analyzing failure cases during repeated practice.
Learners record at least 13 consecutive successful performances out of 24 variant patient case scenarios in the final assessment.

resources: Reaction time test tool for cognitive load measurement

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
